title: Lefschetz manifold
summary: In mathematics, a Lefschetz manifold is a particular kind of symplectic manifold ( M 2 n , ω ) {\displaystyle (M^{2n},\omega )} , sharing a certain cohomological property with Kähler manifolds, that of satisfying the conclusion of the Hard Lefschetz theorem. More precisely, the strong Lefschetz property asks that for k ∈ { 1 , … , n } {\displaystyle k\in \{1,\ldots ,n\}} , the cup product
